forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South southwest wind around 8 mph. Chance of precipitation is 40%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Thursday
forecast.detailedForecast: A chance of rain. Partly sunny. High near 61, with temperatures falling to around 59 in the afternoon. South southwest wind 8 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 22 mph. Chance of precipitation is 50%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the early hours of morning blanket Downtown San Francisco, low clouds hang heavy in the air, cloaked in shades of gray, suggesting that a gentle rain might follow the whispers of the wind. The temperature rests comfortably around fifty-four degrees, a slight chill echoing through the stillness. As daylight approaches, a chance of precipitation looms over the city, with the possibility of light rain only enhancing the melancholic beauty of the morning. The South-Southwest wind continues to stir, promising gusts that evoke the promise of change without overwhelming.

Throughout the day, the weather shall gift us a mix of clouds and the flirtation of sun, though its warmth might be fleeting as the temperature drifts toward a modest sixty-one before settling near fifty-nine by afternoon. The clouds may part just enough to allow glimpses of the sky, but only the most persistent ardor of sunlight will penetrate this veil. As one moves through the day, a light jacket or sweater will serve as an ideal companion against both the coolness of the air and any unexpected rain. Perhaps a quiet stroll along the Embarcadero, sidestepping the shores, could offer a gentle escape—an opportunity to embrace the stillness of the city, listen to the murmur of the waves, or pause with a steaming cup in hand. Today is the kind of day that invites reflection, urging you to slow down just a bit and savor the delicate dance between rain and sunshine.
